page.title: 17Buxton:Housing.
page.content: Buxton has a wide variety of different types of houses. There are many large Victorian and Edwardian houses built in gritstone, particularly around Corbar and Burbage. Local Authority housing is concentrated in the newer part of Fairfield to the east of the main road to Manchester, where there are bungalows and flats for the elderly as well as houses for families. There are several estates of newer owner occupied houses in Burbage and on the road leading south to Harpur Hill. As a guide to house prices in the area in 1985, a modern three bedroomed bungalow was advertised for Â£45,000.
